questions.text: The first Sly in the vault's ancestry was who Egyptian.  What was his name?
questions.explanation:
Slytunkhamen.

	You hear his name first when Sly enters the vault.  He is the first Sly reads about, and by reading them you activate the next portion of the game.  Sly mentions him to Dr. M later in the game.  He says he isn't like Slytunkhamen, a few others, or his dad.  He is just Sly.  Slytunkhamen lived about 1300BC, according to Sly.

questions.text: The second Cooper was a knight.  What was his name?
questions.explanation:
Sir Galleth.

	Sir Galleth's picture is of him on his horse.  He is holding up a flag.  Being a knight, Sir Galleth probably lived in the middle ages.

questions.text: What is the first name of the third Cooper?
questions.explanation:
Salim.

	Salim was said to have the stealth of 40 thieves.  He was the third Cooper in the ancestry to add to the vault, and although Sly marvels at each station, he must continue on.

questions.text: Who was the fourth Cooper in the ancestry Sly read about in the vault?
questions.explanation:
Slaigh MacCooper.

	Slaigh MacCooper, the fourth Cooper who added to the vault, was said to be the strongest Cooper.  He was very large, so probably wasn't so good with spire jumping and whatnot.

Rioichi.

	Rioichi Cooper was the fifth Cooper in the line.  He was another Cooper Sly mentioned to Dr. M, saying he was nothing like any of the Coopers.

questions.text: Who was the only female Cooper Sly found, which was the sixth Cooper in the vault?
questions.explanation:
Henriette.

	Henriette One-Eyed Cooper was the full name.  Henriette was a pirate who sailed the seven seas in search of treasure.  Sly mentions he is a lot like her, since he stole a pirate ship or two along his journey.

questions.text: Who was the seventh Cooper Sly came across?
questions.explanation:
Tennessee Kid Cooper.

	Tennessee Kid was one of the Coopers to add to the vault.  His section held several train tracks that you had to slide on.  Tennessee Kid was the first to master sliding when he first learned to slide on railroad tracks.

questions.text: Who was the Victorian heir and the 8th Cooper?
questions.explanation:
Thadius Winslow Cooper.

	Thadius Winslow Cooper was very wealthy, being a Victorian heir.  He had an eyepiece on in his picture.

questions.text: Who was the ninth Cooper Sly found information on in the vault?
questions.explanation:
Otto Van Cooper.

	Otto Van Cooper was said to be a great fighter.  He was also a great mechanic, and made plenty of planes in his day.  Sly was amazed to see someone who lived so long ago could come up with such great things as a plane.

questions.text: Who is the final Cooper in the vault?
questions.explanation:
Dad & Father.

	We never did find out the name of his father.  In all three Sly's, we never see his face, either.  But because of information we get from foes who knew Sly's father, we know Sly looks a lot like him.  His father makes a series of lasers that Sly must slide down even though he never has before.  Sly was able to do it, though.
